dmca.title: Audio MPEG Makes Patent License ReQuest
dmca.body:
Dear [Private]:

  We represent and are writing on behalf of Audio MPEG, Inc., who has the right to license the patents listed in the attachment to this letter, as well as France Telecom, Telediffusion De France S.A., U.S. Philips Corporation, Koninklijke Philips Electronics N.V., Institut fur Rundfunktechnik GmbH, and Bayerische Rundfunkwerbung GmbH, the owners of these patents.

  ReQuest MP3 Players (regardless of whether they are standing alone or incorporated in other products) and any other ReQuest products capable of encoding and/or decoding MPEG Layer 1, 2, or 3 audio files are covered by at least United States patents Nos. 5,214,678; 5,323,396; and 5,777,992.  For example, these three patents are infringing by the AudioReQuest ARQ2.  In addition, the encoding and/or decoding of MPEG Layer 1, 2, or 3 audio files by ReQuest's Music Loading Service also infringes these three patents.  We enclose copies of these three patents for your convenience.

  A license under the patents listed in the enclosure is available to ReQuest.  Please let me know at your earliest convenience when ReQuest would be available to discuss its infringement and the terms of a license under these patents.

Sincerely,
[Private]
dmca.sender_name: Finnegan, Henderson, Farabow, Garrett & Dunner, LLP
